definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: Though badly damaged by fire, the bus tried to make for its garage.
sentences.chinese: 這輛車雖被大火嚴重燒壞，仍努力開回車庫。

sentences.english: The north wing of the castle was destroyed in a fire.
sentences.chinese: 古堡的北翼毀於一場大火。

sentences.english: The forest fire has raged for several days.
sentences.chinese: 森林大火已經燃燒了好幾天。

sentences.english: The bombers had packed aluminium powder around the explosives to accelerate the fire.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸者在炸藥中添充了鋁粉，其加速了大火的燃燒。

sentences.english: In the big fire, some trees survived.
sentences.chinese: 大火之後，仍有一些樹木殘存。

sentences.english: It also had the ventral gondola under the nose, from which a gunner could fire rearwards .
sentences.chinese: 它還腹側敞車下鼻子，從其中一名炮手可大火在後面。

sentences.english: Rain opens up and douses the fire.
The fire builds, devouring everything in its path.
sentences.chinese: 兇猛的大火將沿途上的一切都吞噬。

sentences.english: Add in black fungus,bell pepper and carrots.
sentences.chinese: 隨放木耳，青椒絲和胡蘿蔔絲大火翻炒。

sentences.english: The fire was completely overcome by daybreak.
sentences.chinese: 黎明時大火已被完全撲滅。

sentences.english: Almost a hundred people perished in the hotel fire last night.
sentences.chinese: 近百人在昨夜旅館的大火中喪生。

sentences.english: The death toll of a big fire that engulfed a high-rise building in downtown Shanghai had risen to 53 by 9:20 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 昨天，上海市中區的一棟住宅樓被大火吞沒。

sentences.english: The great forest fire may have had a natural cause instead of a human cause.
sentences.chinese: 這場森林大火可能是由天火引起的。

sentences.english: The people who stood on the avenue tried to extinguish the fire, but it's of no avail.
sentences.chinese: 站在林蔭道上的人們想熄滅大火，但不起作用。

sentences.english: The fires were spreading in all directions in the dry conditions.
sentences.chinese: 大火在乾燥的天氣下正向四面八方蔓延。

definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to catch fire/to cook/to get angry
to have a fever reaching (a certain temperature)
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
to discharge smoke/to fume with rage
